block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday the rate was 5.75 percent on the outstanding three-month bill and 5.91 percent on the six-month bill.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday the rate was 5.75 percent on the outstanding three-month bill and 5.91 percent on the six-month bill.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week: TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Jones Intercable Inc., $150 million of senior notes due 2002. Salomon Brothers.
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit. TAX EXEMPT WEDNESDAY
Port Authority New York/New Jersey, $86 million of consolidated revenue bonds. Competitive. THURSDAY
Virginia Housing Development Authority, $100 million of commonwealth mortgage revenue bonds. Competitive. ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Abilene (Tex.) Health Facilities for Hendrick Medical Center, $50 million of revenue bonds. Lehman Brothers.
Community Development Administration Department of Housing and Community Development, $100 million of single-family program bonds for the State of Maryland. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Maine State Housing Authority, $50 million of mortgage purchase bonds. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
New York City, $795 million of general-obligation bonds. Goldman, Sachs.
New York Local Government Assistant Corp., $350 million of revenue bonds. Paine Webber Inc.
New York State Medical Care Facilities Finance Agency, $167.2 million of mental health services bonds. Goldman, Sachs.
Pennsylvania Higher Educational Facility Authority, $160 million of revenue bonds for trustees of the University of Pennsylvania. Grigsby Brandford & Co..
State of California Department of Resources, $76 million of revenue bonds for Central Valley water system project. J. P. Morgan Securities Inc.
